title: Water Quality Laboratory Analysis and Reporting Dataset – Malawi (2017–2019)
text: dataset captures water quality test results various water points across Malawi, collected 2017 2019 using mWater platform. includes metadata sample collection events, site geolocation, submission approval timelines, laboratory analysis outcomes. data reflects structured workflows monitoring water safety, supporting operational decision-making long-term water quality management. Intended Users Applications Water Utilities Service Providers: monitor quality water different sources, schedule maintenance treatment, improve service delivery. Environmental Health Officers District Councils: identify unsafe water points, plan targeted inspections, coordinate local water safety interventions. WASH Program Implementers: assess baseline water quality conditions, prioritize high-risk areas, track impact water safety programs. Academic Institutions Research Bodies: analyze regional seasonal trends water quality contribute evidence base safe water practices low-resource settings. Government Ministries: inform national water safety planning, update regulations, allocate resources based real-world data. Development Agencies International Donors: evaluate program outcomes, justify investments, align support areas greatest water quality need.

title: Water Quality Laboratory Analysis and Reporting Dataset – Malawi (2017–2019)
code: library(boreholelabdata) # Visualization 1: Water Quality Compliance Summary # Purpose: Display number of samples that meet or exceed Malawian standards per parameter # Load required libraries library(dplyr) library(tidyr) library(ggplot2)  # Select relevant compliance columns and reshape to long format compliance_long <- boreholelabdata %>%   select(fluoride_within_standards,          nitrate_within_standards,          ph_within_mw_standards) %>%   pivot_longer(cols = everything(),                names_to = "parameter",                values_to = "compliance") %>%   filter(!is.na(compliance)) %>%   mutate(parameter = case_when(     parameter == "fluoride_within_standards" ~ "Fluoride",     parameter == "nitrate_within_standards" ~ "Nitrate",     parameter == "ph_within_mw_standards" ~ "pH",     TRUE ~ parameter   ))  # Count compliance status by parameter compliance_summary <- compliance_long %>%   group_by(parameter, compliance) %>%   summarise(count = n(), .groups = "drop")  # Plot stacked bar chart ggplot(compliance_summary, aes(x = parameter, y = count, fill = compliance)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   scale_fill_manual(values = c("Yes" = "green", "No" = "red")) +   labs(     title = "Water Quality Compliance Summary",     x = "Parameter",     y = "Number of Samples",     fill = "Within Standards"   ) +   theme_minimal()
